pros: Has all of the bells and whistles. Good working environment. You are expected and encouraged to operate at your level while working your shift as ED Tech, not just an IV starter and bed pusher. You are able to continue care for the Pt you brought in on the ambulance and follow them through to discharge.
cons: The office is tiny and difficult to do reports while the shift is there. Not your typical third service EMS. You are part of the ED, and some expectations can be unreasonable. Ambulances are used well past their livelihood.

review_title: No discount if you see any of the physicians here or if you go to the ER/UC
pros: You have a job if you work here, and the commute is GREAT
cons: Divine Savior is a great place to work, as it is just great to have a job. Management is horrible there is no communication, no sympathy (example you need to leave because your child is sick or you are all you will get is an OK, no I hope you guys are better soon or anything) instead you are made to feel horrible about it NO MATTER THE SITUATION example you have a death in your family, they don't care. This may not pertain to all Managers but at least half. We do have a gym on site you get a whole $5 off WOW right!!  Your vacation, holiday and sick pay is rolled all into one I think you get about 6 hrs each paycheck - I know awesome right? Also if you miss or are late 8 times you are fired, in a rolling calendar year, even if you are only late by 8 mins (which is technically 1 min as we have a 7 minute lead way) Now if your manager likes you she may let you slid on the late thing.  Oh we also have childcare on site which I think it is around 170 a week maybe more - but NO discount for you employees. We do get a 10% Culvers discount ONLY in Portage - but hey it's Culvers and the food is awesome!! Some people that would in the building are nice others are not. YOU CAN NOT SMOKE - although you walk around the hospital and other places on your 15 minute break (by the way not all departments get this) but even though you are walking even off property you cannot smoke.. well you can just don't let anyone see you because they tattle pretty quick. Also, don't be surprised if your coworker(s) do not do there job or are constantly messing up (this is pertaining to the dept. I work in  cashier, billing, reception that type of thing. Anyways you will see this proof of messing up time and time again yet you can still keep your job.. WTH right I am sure there is more but until next time. Also, you will get emails saying you did something incorrectly,  however they normally do not show you proof of your mistake, so really how will we ever learn, plus instead of just emailing you to inform you of this they have to CC everyone under the sun.  Also, there are ALOT of people here that are on a high horse and they think they are better than us lowly workers, it's pretty sad yet entertaining.

review_title: Medical-surgical and cardiac/pulmonary rehab nursing opportunities

cons: Infrequent postings of other available positions (employees must be satisfied), potential pay discrepancy with larger organizations, not focused on research

pros: Pay is good, flexible with schedule when needed, most staff is very friendly and caring.

pros: None, I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone seeking employment unless you like being treated poorly.  Conditions are never as what you are told in an interview.
cons: High stress, low pay, lying managers and supervisors, a worthless HR department, poor patient care, overall crabby and complaining staff in every department, no teamwork or communication, costs are inflated in every way possible.

pros: Small town atmosphere with family-like vibe. Easy to stay in touch and contact providers and outreach to internal departments.
cons: Too many software systems that do not communicate easily together. Cumbersome and outdated documentation systems.

pros: Pay is ok. And insurance is alright, as long as you doctor in house.
